name: The Boathouse Hotel

reviews.text: I’ve been to Holyhead a few times now with work, I think my boss hates me. Out of all the hotels I’ve stayed in, this is one of the best for Holyhead. The room I had was a good sized double of average cleanliness, not as clean as my ship. The TV is the smallest I’ve ever seen; it’s so small it’s funny. I used the man’s ruler to measurer it, it’s just over six inches wide. The bathroom is one the largest I’ve ever seen in Holyhead, for those who have never been to Holyhead before it is the land of small bathrooms. The major defect of the room is the tea boat. What no biscuits!! The tea bags are also the individual sort, you know the ones taken out of a larger box with no protective cover, so by the time you use them they are all dried out. One of the major plus points are the staff, all the staff I came in contact with were very helpful. The lovely lady that serves breakfast would also be great as the local tourist guide. All the food in the hotel is good hardy working mans food.
reviews.title: Good For Holyhead.

reviews.text: Stayed at the Boathouse hotel, checked in swiftly...was shown to my room by a young lady, had a shower which was ok....tv was small but i wasnt bothered as was going to be doing other things than sitting in the room..bed was fine.
reviews.title: Fat Rowdy and Rude locals swearing and blocking the bar area.

reviews.text: i sat in the restaurant which is nicely Decorated had a lovely meal cant complain about that.
reviews.title: OK - What you pay is what you get. Owner nice and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night on our way to Ireland. We had a lovely view over the harbour. Our dinner and breakfast were both lovely. Definitely request a room with an ocean view. Made for a relaxing start to our holiday in Ireland.
reviews.title: Lovely B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An interesting stay. We booked as it was near the ferry. I consider the price too high. This is a fair £60-00 motel, not an £80-00 Hotel! Walls too thin, shower defective, bed not made properly and "Faulty Towers" at breakfast. We would not hurry back!
reviews.title: Not too good

reviews.text: This isn't a modern chain hotel, so don't expect standard rooms and facilities. Instead you get slightly old fashioned rooms, but with friendly service.
reviews.title: Great stopping point before the ferry

reviews.text: Breakfast was good enough to make us regret not arriving in time for dinner the night before.
reviews.title: Improvements made but still well overpriced

reviews.text: Nice view from our room and literally minutes from the ferry which meant a nice relaxed start to our holiday in Ireland.
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ,,,,,We stayed one night, the room was great, replete with a four poster large bed.... decent sized. Free WIFI did'nt work in the room though.... Nice supper in the pub, good food, good price........... Excellent (included) breakfast in the morning.... All in all Good Value!
reviews.title: Very nice hotel..

reviews.text: I stayed at the Boathouse Hotel for a couple of nights during my recent trip to Wales, I wish it had been longer, I thoroughly enjoyed my time there. I found the staff very helpful, very welcoming and they all made me feel very welcome indeed and very friendly many a chat or a laugh was had!! I loved my room, it was beautiful, spacious, clean & comfy!! The breakfasts were absolutely yummy and more than enough to send you out on a days sight seeing and Sandra is lovely!!! Please don't be put off by negative reviews, I found the Boathouse a wonderful experience in every way and would definitley go back to stay again!! Thanks everyone for making my trip even more wonderful than it already was, cheers : )
reviews.title: Loved It! Would Go Again!

reviews.text: We did not stay in this hotel overnight and so have no comments or experiences of the accomodation. However, we visited the hotel one Sunday afternoon when visiting Holyhead and saw a banner on the side of the hotel for Sunday Roast. There were four adults and we all ordered a Full Sunday Roast, two ordered Turkey, one ordered Pork and one Beef. The meals came out of the kitchen within three minutes of us ordering. The meat was dry, the vegetables were bland and tasted of nothing and the most disgusting part was the roast potatoes that literally disintegrated into a pool of oil when cut into. The attitude of the waitress when I pointed out to her that the Pork I ordered was Turkey was 'It must be Pork if that is what you ordered'. It was Turkey. I have read other reviews on this site and it appears that everything about this hotel is Hit and Miss. Our visit to this hotel on the Sunday that the Holyhead RNLI had their open day was definetly a MISS. In all my time eating in restaurants I have never demanded my money back but this time I did and to be fair to the management they gave us a full refund,
reviews.title: THE FOOD WAS DISGUSTING

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for an overnight stay before sailing to Ireland the next day. The hotel is perfectly located at the far end of the beach, and our room had a lovely sea view. The room was very spacious with a (to our surprise) four poster bed. A large, wonderfully comfy sofa was in the room, where we could sit and read, look at maps and plan our journey. This was an unexpected treat. The bathroom was pretty basic, no bath, just a shower, but perfectly good enough for what we needed. All the staff we met were friendly and welcoming. We ate dinner there, but struggled to find a vegetarian option, so in that sense the food was a little old-fashioned. If you are looking for a glamorous hotel, don't stay here. But we enjoyed our stay. It was convenient, comfy and friendly and served our purpose well. We set off the next day feeling very well rested.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at he Boathouse and booked at short notice!! it must be said we had reservations after reading some negative reviews. All I can say is that I really do not understand what these other people were complaining about!!
reviews.title: Would stay again very nice do not be put off by negative reviews
Definitely Overpriced !!
reviews.text: Stay the one night ,that was enough, the whole place needs a facelift. Reception area was a right tip. The room was small but clean and the bed quite comfortable, the shower was good too !biggest disappointment was the postage stamp size tv, and creaky floor boards, snoring in the next room made my night a long one !! Not much sound proofing there. The breakfast good and the staff pleasant.. Definitely was not worth £60 quid... Definitely not !!! Would certainly give this place a miss next time I'm in town !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the outside wall of this hotel there is a huge sign proclaiming 'AA2 star - Luxury accommodation....'
reviews.title: Not my definition of 'Luxury'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I do not know in what universe anything offered by this hotel could be classed as luxurious.
reviews.title: If you need a hotel in Holyhead stay here!

reviews.text: The reception area decor is dated, shabby and unwelcoming. As we were shown to our room, my heart sank as we were taken through corridors of more shabby decor, and my worst fears were realised when we arrived at our room.
reviews.title: yet another pleasent stay

reviews.text: Old pine furniture, mismatched decor (striped wallpaper, checked bed linen). The bathroom was dark, dank, and not very clean. The grouting is dirty, the mirror tarnished. My husband attempted to have a shower, but when he finally managed to get hot water, the pressure all but vanished.
reviews.title: Not bad for Holyhead !!

description: The Boathouse is a family run AA 2** highly recommended Hotel which overlooks the Irish sea and is on the perimeter of the Breakwater Park. We are open all year with ample free car parking and are only four minutes from the ferry port. We offer 19 luxury en-suite bedrooms in a combination of single, double, twin and family rooms. All rooms are equipped with tea & coffee facilities and television. Awaken your senses by sampling one of our freshly made Italian cappuccinos whilst taking in the panoramic views of the harbour and marina from our conservatory.Our bistro with its relaxed ambiance offers a wide range of freshly prepared bar snacks along with a specials board which is changed daily. Locally caught fish and lobster is our speciality. As wine importers we offer personallyselected wines from the Friuli region of Italy each wine has its own individual character. Wine tastings are especially welcome. Cash & Carry prices available.
